page.title: 13RIVER AND RIVER CROSSINGS
page.content: The River Kennett runs through our area from Dalham to Kentford. There are 8 bridges but Packhorse Bridge in Moulton is the oldest. It is an official monument and was built in 1446 in the Anjou Period, although there is evidence that a bridge has existed since Roman times. Packhorse Bridge and another are of flint construction, both of which have recently been renovated. There are also two fords in Moulton to enable large vehicles to cross the river, as the Packhorse Bridge is for pedestrians and the other only for light traffic. Another very old bridge carries the mainroad through Kentford. Because the land is very chalky the River Kennett is dry for much of the year but in periods of heavy rain it can flood very quickly In the late 1960's it flooded twice causing consderable damage.
